name: Order and Disorder I: Issues and Perspectives
description: Societies require law and order, but at what point does order become oppression? How do we balance our need for freedom and societyâ€™s need for order? This interdisciplinary seminar allows students to explore these and related questions through selected readings introducing theories from sociology, political science, philosophy, and history. Restricted to first-year students. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
exclusions: INI One, MUN One, NEW One, SMC One, TRN One, UNI One, VIC One, WDW153H1, WDW154H1
